property.name: mapred.reduce.tasks
property.description: The default number of reduce tasks per job. Typically set to a prime close to the number of available hosts. Ignored when mapred.job.tracker is "local". Hadoop set this to 1 by default, whereas hive uses -1 as its default value. By setting this property to -1, Hive will automatically figure out what should be the number of reducers.

property.name: hive.exec.reducers.bytes.per.reducer
property.description: size per reducer.The default is 1G, i.e if the input size is 10G, it will use 10 reducers.

property.name: hive.exec.reducers.max
property.description: max number of reducers will be used. If the one specified in the configuration parameter mapred.reduce.tasks is negative, hive will use this one as the max number of reducers when automatically determine number of reducers.

property.name: hive.cli.print.header
property.description: Whether to print the names of the columns in query output.

property.name: hive.cli.print.current.db
property.description: Whether to include the current database in the hive prompt.

property.name: hive.exec.scratchdir
property.description: Scratch space for Hive jobs

property.name: hive.test.mode
property.description: whether hive is running in test mode. If yes, it turns on sampling and prefixes the output tablename

property.name: hive.test.mode.prefix
property.description: if hive is running in test mode, prefixes the output table by this string

property.name: hive.test.mode.samplefreq
property.description: if hive is running in test mode and table is not bucketed, sampling frequency

property.name: hive.test.mode.nosamplelist
property.description: if hive is running in test mode, dont sample the above comma seperated list of tables

property.name: hive.metastore.local
property.description: controls whether to connect to remove metastore server or open a new metastore server in Hive Client JVM

property.name: javax.jdo.option.ConnectionURL
property.description: JDBC connect string for a JDBC metastore

property.name: javax.jdo.option.ConnectionDriverName
property.description: Driver class name for a JDBC metastore

property.name: javax.jdo.PersistenceManagerFactoryClass
property.description: class implementing the jdo persistence

property.name: javax.jdo.option.DetachAllOnCommit
property.description: detaches all objects from session so that they can be used after transaction is committed

property.name: javax.jdo.option.NonTransactionalRead
property.description: reads outside of transactions

property.name: javax.jdo.option.ConnectionUserName
property.description: username to use against metastore database

property.name: javax.jdo.option.ConnectionPassword
property.description: password to use against metastore database

property.name: javax.jdo.option.Multithreaded
property.description: Set this to true if multiple threads access metastore through JDO concurrently.

property.name: datanucleus.connectionPoolingType
property.description: Uses a DBCP connection pool for JDBC metastore

property.name: datanucleus.validateTables
property.description: validates existing schema against code. turn this on if you want to verify existing schema

property.name: datanucleus.validateColumns
property.description: validates existing schema against code. turn this on if you want to verify existing schema

property.name: datanucleus.validateConstraints
property.description: validates existing schema against code. turn this on if you want to verify existing schema

property.name: datanucleus.storeManagerType
property.description: metadata store type

property.name: datanucleus.autoCreateSchema
property.description: creates necessary schema on a startup if one doesn't exist. set this to false, after creating it once

property.name: datanucleus.autoStartMechanismMode
property.description: throw exception if metadata tables are incorrect

property.name: datanucleus.transactionIsolation
property.description: Default transaction isolation level for identity generation.

property.name: datanucleus.cache.level2
property.description: Use a level 2 cache. Turn this off if metadata is changed independently of hive metastore server

property.name: datanucleus.cache.level2.type
property.description: SOFT=soft reference based cache, WEAK=weak reference based cache.

property.name: datanucleus.identifierFactory
property.description: Name of the identifier factory to use when generating table/column names etc. 'datanucleus' is used for backward compatibility

property.name: datanucleus.plugin.pluginRegistryBundleCheck
property.description: Defines what happens when plugin bundles are found and are duplicated [EXCEPTION|LOG|NONE]

property.name: hive.metastore.warehouse.dir
property.description: location of default database for the warehouse

property.name: hive.metastore.event.listeners
property.description: list of comma seperated listeners for metastore events.

property.name: hive.metastore.event.expiry.duration
property.description: Duration after which events expire from events table (in seconds)

property.name: hive.metastore.event.clean.freq
property.description: Frequency at which timer task runs to purge expired events in metastore(in seconds).

property.name: hive.metastore.connect.retries
property.description: Number of retries while opening a connection to metastore

property.name: hive.metastore.client.connect.retry.delay
property.description: Number of seconds for the client to wait between consecutive connection attempts

property.name: hive.metastore.client.socket.timeout
property.description: MetaStore Client socket timeout in seconds

property.name: hive.metastore.rawstore.impl
property.description: Name of the class that implements org.apache.hadoop.hive.metastore.rawstore interface. This class is used to store and retrieval of raw metadata objects such as table, database

property.name: hive.metastore.batch.retrieve.max
property.description: Maximum number of objects (tables/partitions) can be retrieved from metastore in one batch. The higher the number, the less the number of round trips is needed to the Hive metastore server, but it may also cause higher memory requirement at the client side.

property.name: hive.default.fileformat
property.description: Default file format for CREATE TABLE statement. Options are TextFile and SequenceFile. Users can explicitly say CREATE TABLE ... STORED AS <TEXTFILE|SEQUENCEFILE> to override

property.name: hive.fileformat.check
property.description: Whether to check file format or not when loading data files

property.name: hive.map.aggr
property.description: Whether to use map-side aggregation in Hive Group By queries

property.name: hive.groupby.skewindata
property.description: Whether there is skew in data to optimize group by queries

property.name: hive.groupby.mapaggr.checkinterval
property.description: Number of rows after which size of the grouping keys/aggregation classes is performed

property.name: hive.mapred.local.mem
property.description: For local mode, memory of the mappers/reducers

property.name: hive.mapjoin.followby.map.aggr.hash.percentmemory
property.description: Portion of total memory to be used by map-side grup aggregation hash table, when this group by is followed by map join

property.name: hive.map.aggr.hash.force.flush.memory.threshold
property.description: The max memory to be used by map-side grup aggregation hash table, if the memory usage is higher than this number, force to flush data

property.name: hive.map.aggr.hash.percentmemory
property.description: Portion of total memory to be used by map-side grup aggregation hash table

property.name: hive.map.aggr.hash.min.reduction
property.description: Hash aggregation will be turned off if the ratio between hash table size and input rows is bigger than this number. Set to 1 to make sure hash aggregation is never turned off.

property.name: hive.optimize.cp
property.description: Whether to enable column pruner

property.name: hive.optimize.index.filter
property.description: Whether to enable automatic use of indexes

property.name: hive.optimize.index.groupby
property.description: Whether to enable optimization of group-by queries using Aggregate indexes.

property.name: hive.optimize.ppd
property.description: Whether to enable predicate pushdown

property.name: hive.optimize.ppd.storage
property.description: Whether to push predicates down into storage handlers. Ignored when hive.optimize.ppd is false.

property.name: hive.ppd.recognizetransivity
property.description: Whether to transitively replicate predicate filters over equijoin conditions.

property.name: hive.optimize.pruner
property.description: Whether to enable the new partition pruner which depends on predicate pushdown. If this is disabled, the old partition pruner which is based on AST will be enabled.

property.name: hive.optimize.groupby
property.description: Whether to enable the bucketed group by from bucketed partitions/tables.

property.name: hive.multigroupby.singlemr
property.description: Whether to optimize multi group by query to generate single M/R job plan. If the multi group by query has common group by keys, it will be optimized to generate single M/R job.

property.name: hive.join.emit.interval
property.description: How many rows in the right-most join operand Hive should buffer before emitting the join result.

property.name: hive.join.cache.size
property.description: How many rows in the joining tables (except the streaming table) should be cached in memory.

property.name: hive.mapjoin.bucket.cache.size
property.description: How many values in each keys in the map-joined table should be cached in memory.

property.name: hive.mapjoin.maxsize
property.description: Maximum # of rows of the small table that can be handled by map-side join. If the size is reached and hive.task.progress is set, a fatal error counter is set and the job will be killed.

property.name: hive.mapjoin.cache.numrows
property.description: How many rows should be cached by jdbm for map join.

property.name: hive.optimize.skewjoin
property.description: Whether to enable skew join optimization.

property.name: hive.skewjoin.key
property.description: Determine if we get a skew key in join. If we see more than the specified number of rows with the same key in join operator, we think the key as a skew join key.

property.name: hive.skewjoin.mapjoin.map.tasks
property.description: Determine the number of map task used in the follow up map join job for a skew join. It should be used together with hive.skewjoin.mapjoin.min.split to perform a fine grained control.

property.name: hive.skewjoin.mapjoin.min.split
property.description: Determine the number of map task at most used in the follow up map join job for a skew join by specifying the minimum split size. It should be used together with hive.skewjoin.mapjoin.map.tasks to perform a fine grained control.

property.name: hive.mapred.mode
property.description: The mode in which the hive operations are being performed. In strict mode, some risky queries are not allowed to run

property.name: hive.exec.script.maxerrsize
property.description: Maximum number of bytes a script is allowed to emit to standard error (per map-reduce task). This prevents runaway scripts from filling logs partitions to capacity

property.name: hive.exec.script.allow.partial.consumption
property.description: When enabled, this option allows a user script to exit successfully without consuming all the data from the standard input.

property.name: hive.script.operator.id.env.var
property.description: Name of the environment variable that holds the unique script operator ID in the user's transform function (the custom mapper/reducer that the user has specified in the query)

property.name: hive.exec.compress.output
property.description: This controls whether the final outputs of a query (to a local/hdfs file or a hive table) is compressed. The compression codec and other options are determined from hadoop config variables mapred.output.compress*

property.name: hive.exec.compress.intermediate
property.description: This controls whether intermediate files produced by hive between multiple map-reduce jobs are compressed. The compression codec and other options are determined from hadoop config variables mapred.output.compress*

property.name: hive.exec.parallel
property.description: Whether to execute jobs in parallel

property.name: hive.exec.parallel.thread.number
property.description: How many jobs at most can be executed in parallel

property.name: hive.exec.rowoffset
property.description: Whether to provide the row offset virtual column

property.name: hive.task.progress
property.description: Whether Hive should periodically update task progress counters during execution. Enabling this allows task progress to be monitored more closely in the job tracker, but may impose a performance penalty. This flag is automatically set to true for jobs with hive.exec.dynamic.partition set to true.

property.name: hive.hwi.war.file
property.description: This sets the path to the HWI war file, relative to ${HIVE_HOME}.

property.name: hive.hwi.listen.host
property.description: This is the host address the Hive Web Interface will listen on

property.name: hive.hwi.listen.port
property.description: This is the port the Hive Web Interface will listen on

property.name: hive.exec.pre.hooks
property.description: Comma-separated list of pre-execution hooks to be invoked for each statement. A pre-execution hook is specified as the name of a Java class which implements the org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.hooks.ExecuteWithHookContext interface.

property.name: hive.exec.post.hooks
property.description: Comma-separated list of post-execution hooks to be invoked for each statement. A post-execution hook is specified as the name of a Java class which implements the org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.hooks.ExecuteWithHookContext interface.

property.name: hive.exec.failure.hooks
property.description: Comma-separated list of on-failure hooks to be invoked for each statement. An on-failure hook is specified as the name of Java class which implements the org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.hooks.ExecuteWithHookContext interface.

property.name: hive.client.stats.publishers
property.description: Comma-separated list of statistics publishers to be invoked on counters on each job. A client stats publisher is specified as the name of a Java class which implements the org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.stats.ClientStatsPublisher interface.

property.name: hive.client.stats.counters
property.description: Subset of counters that should be of interest for hive.client.stats.publishers (when one wants to limit their publishing). Non-display names should be used

property.name: hive.merge.mapfiles
property.description: Merge small files at the end of a map-only job

property.name: hive.merge.mapredfiles
property.description: Merge small files at the end of a map-reduce job

property.name: hive.mergejob.maponly
property.description: Try to generate a map-only job for merging files if CombineHiveInputFormat is supported.

property.name: hive.heartbeat.interval
property.description: Send a heartbeat after this interval - used by mapjoin and filter operators

property.name: hive.merge.size.per.task
property.description: Size of merged files at the end of the job

property.name: hive.merge.smallfiles.avgsize
property.description: When the average output file size of a job is less than this number, Hive will start an additional map-reduce job to merge the output files into bigger files. This is only done for map-only jobs if hive.merge.mapfiles is true, and for map-reduce jobs if hive.merge.mapredfiles is true.

property.name: hive.mapjoin.hashtable.initialCapacity
property.description: In the process of Mapjoin, the key/value will be hold in the hashtable. This value means the initialCapacity of the in-memory hashtable

property.name: hive.mapjoin.hashtable.loadfactor
property.description: In the process of Mapjoin, the key/value will be hold in the hashtable. This value means the load factor for the in-memory hashtable

property.name: hive.mapjoin.smalltable.filesize
property.description: The threshold for the input file size of the small tables; if the file size is smaller than this threshold, it will try to convert the common join into map join

property.name: hive.mapjoin.localtask.max.memory.usage
property.description: This number means how much memory the local task can take to hold the key/value into in-memory hash table; If the local task's memory usage is more than this number, the local task will be abort by themself. It means the data of small table is too large to be hold in the memory.

property.name: hive.mapjoin.followby.gby.localtask.max.memory.usage
property.description: This number means how much memory the local task can take to hold the key/value into in-memory hash table when this map join followed by a group by; If the local task's memory usage is more than this number, the local task will be abort by themself. It means the data of small table is too large to be hold in the memory.

property.name: hive.mapjoin.check.memory.rows
property.description: The number means after how many rows processed it needs to check the memory usage

property.name: hive.auto.convert.join
property.description: Whether Hive enable the optimization about converting common join into mapjoin based on the input file size

property.name: hive.script.auto.progress
property.description: Whether Hive Tranform/Map/Reduce Clause should automatically send progress information to TaskTracker to avoid the task getting killed because of inactivity. Hive sends progress information when the script is outputting to stderr. This option removes the need of periodically producing stderr messages, but users should be cautious because this may prevent infinite loops in the scripts to be killed by TaskTracker.

property.name: hive.script.serde
property.description: The default serde for trasmitting input data to and reading output data from the user scripts.

property.name: hive.script.recordreader
property.description: The default record reader for reading data from the user scripts.

property.name: hive.script.recordwriter
property.description: The default record writer for writing data to the user scripts.

property.name: hive.input.format
property.description: The default input format. Set this to HiveInputFormat if you encounter problems with CombineHiveInputFormat.

property.name: hive.udtf.auto.progress
property.description: Whether Hive should automatically send progress information to TaskTracker when using UDTF's to prevent the task getting killed because of inactivity. Users should be cautious because this may prevent TaskTracker from killing tasks with infinte loops.

property.name: hive.mapred.reduce.tasks.speculative.execution
property.description: Whether speculative execution for reducers should be turned on.

property.name: hive.exec.counters.pull.interval
property.description: The interval with which to poll the JobTracker for the counters the running job. The smaller it is the more load there will be on the jobtracker, the higher it is the less granular the caught will be.

property.name: hive.enforce.bucketing
property.description: Whether bucketing is enforced. If true, while inserting into the table, bucketing is enforced.

property.name: hive.enforce.sorting
property.description: Whether sorting is enforced. If true, while inserting into the table, sorting is enforced.

property.name: hive.metastore.ds.connection.url.hook
property.description: Name of the hook to use for retriving the JDO connection URL. If empty, the value in javax.jdo.option.ConnectionURL is used

property.name: hive.metastore.ds.retry.attempts
property.description: The number of times to retry a metastore call if there were a connection error

property.name: hive.metastore.ds.retry.interval
property.description: The number of miliseconds between metastore retry attempts

property.name: hive.metastore.server.min.threads
property.description: Minimum number of worker threads in the Thrift server's pool.

property.name: hive.metastore.server.max.threads
property.description: Maximum number of worker threads in the Thrift server's pool.

property.name: hive.metastore.server.tcp.keepalive
property.description: Whether to enable TCP keepalive for the metastore server. Keepalive will prevent accumulation of half-open connections.

property.name: hive.metastore.sasl.enabled
property.description: If true, the metastore thrift interface will be secured with SASL. Clients must authenticate with Kerberos.

property.name: hive.metastore.kerberos.keytab.file
property.description: The path to the Kerberos Keytab file containing the metastore thrift server's service principal.

property.name: hive.metastore.kerberos.principal
property.description: The service principal for the metastore thrift server. The special string _HOST will be replaced automatically with the correct host name.

property.name: hive.metastore.cache.pinobjtypes
property.description: List of comma separated metastore object types that should be pinned in the cache

property.name: hive.optimize.reducededuplication
property.description: Remove extra map-reduce jobs if the data is already clustered by the same key which needs to be used again. This should always be set to true. Since it is a new feature, it has been made configurable.

property.name: hive.exec.dynamic.partition
property.description: Whether or not to allow dynamic partitions in DML/DDL.

property.name: hive.exec.dynamic.partition.mode
property.description: In strict mode, the user must specify at least one static partition in case the user accidentally overwrites all partitions.

property.name: hive.exec.max.dynamic.partitions
property.description: Maximum number of dynamic partitions allowed to be created in total.

property.name: hive.exec.max.dynamic.partitions.pernode
property.description: Maximum number of dynamic partitions allowed to be created in each mapper/reducer node.

property.name: hive.exec.max.created.files
property.description: Maximum number of HDFS files created by all mappers/reducers in a MapReduce job.

property.name: hive.exec.default.partition.name
property.description: The default partition name in case the dynamic partition column value is null/empty string or anyother values that cannot be escaped. This value must not contain any special character used in HDFS URI (e.g., ':', '%', '/' etc). The user has to be aware that the dynamic partition value should not contain this value to avoid confusions.

property.name: hive.stats.dbclass
property.description: The default database that stores temporary hive statistics.

property.name: hive.stats.autogather
property.description: A flag to gather statistics automatically during the INSERT OVERWRITE command.

property.name: hive.stats.jdbcdriver
property.description: The JDBC driver for the database that stores temporary hive statistics.

property.name: hive.stats.dbconnectionstring
property.description: The default connection string for the database that stores temporary hive statistics.

property.name: hive.stats.default.publisher
property.description: The Java class (implementing the StatsPublisher interface) that is used by default if hive.stats.dbclass is not JDBC or HBase.

property.name: hive.stats.default.aggregator
property.description: The Java class (implementing the StatsAggregator interface) that is used by default if hive.stats.dbclass is not JDBC or HBase.

property.name: hive.stats.jdbc.timeout
property.description: Timeout value (number of seconds) used by JDBC connection and statements.

property.name: hive.stats.jdbc.atomic
property.description: If this is set to true then the metastore stats will be updated only if all types of stats (# of rows, # of files, # of bytes etc.) are available. Otherwise metastore stats are updated in a best effort fashion with whatever are available.

property.name: hive.stats.retries.max
property.description: Maximum number of retries when stats publisher/aggregator got an exception updating intermediate database. Default is no tries on failures.

property.name: hive.stats.retries.wait
property.description: The base waiting window (in milliseconds) before the next retry. The actual wait time is calculated by baseWindow * failues + baseWindow * (failure + 1) * (random number between [0.0,1.0]).

property.name: hive.support.concurrency
property.description: Whether hive supports concurrency or not. A zookeeper instance must be up and running for the default hive lock manager to support read-write locks.

property.name: hive.concurrency.manager
property.description: The concurrency manager for hive.

property.name: hive.lock.numretries
property.description: The number of times you want to try to get all the locks

property.name: hive.lock.sleep.between.retries
property.description: The sleep time (in seconds) between various retries

property.name: hive.zookeeper.quorum
property.description: The list of zookeeper servers to talk to. This is only needed for read/write locks.

property.name: hive.zookeeper.client.port
property.description: The port of zookeeper servers to talk to. This is only needed for read/write locks.

property.name: hive.zookeeper.session.timeout
property.description: Zookeeper client's session timeout. The client is disconnected, and as a result, all locks released, if a heartbeat is not sent in the timeout.

property.name: hive.zookeeper.namespace
property.description: The parent node under which all zookeeper nodes are created.

property.name: hive.zookeeper.clean.extra.nodes
property.description: Clean extra nodes at the end of the session.

property.name: fs.har.impl
property.description: The implementation for accessing Hadoop Archives. Note that this won't be applicable to Hadoop vers less than 0.20

property.name: hive.archive.enabled
property.description: Whether archiving operations are permitted

property.name: hive.archive.har.parentdir.settable
property.description: In new Hadoop versions, the parent directory must be set while creating a HAR. Because this functionality is hard to detect with just version numbers, this conf var needs to be set manually.

property.name: hive.fetch.output.serde
property.description: The serde used by FetchTask to serialize the fetch output.

property.name: hive.exec.mode.local.auto
property.description: Let hive determine whether to run in local mode automatically

property.name: hive.exec.drop.ignorenonexistent
property.description: Do not report an error if DROP TABLE/VIEW specifies a non-existent table/view

property.name: hive.exec.show.job.failure.debug.info
property.description: If a job fails, whether to provide a link in the CLI to the task with the most failures, along with debugging hints if applicable.

property.name: hive.auto.progress.timeout
property.description: How long to run autoprogressor for the script/UDTF operators (in seconds). Set to 0 for forever.

property.name: hive.hbase.wal.enabled
property.description: Whether writes to HBase should be forced to the write-ahead log. Disabling this improves HBase write performance at the risk of lost writes in case of a crash.

property.name: hive.table.parameters.default
property.description: Default property values for newly created tables

property.name: hive.variable.substitute
property.description: This enables substitution using syntax like ${var} ${system:var} and ${env:var}.

property.name: hive.security.authorization.enabled
property.description: enable or disable the hive client authorization

property.name: hive.security.authorization.manager
property.description: the hive client authorization manager class name. The user defined authorization class should implement interface org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.security.authorization.HiveAuthorizationProvider.

property.name: hive.security.authenticator.manager
property.description: hive client authenticator manager class name. The user defined authenticator should implement interface org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.security.HiveAuthenticationProvider.

property.name: hive.security.authorization.createtable.user.grants
property.description: the privileges automatically granted to some users whenever a table gets created. An example like "userX,userY:select;userZ:create" will grant select privilege to userX and userY, and grant create privilege to userZ whenever a new table created.

property.name: hive.security.authorization.createtable.group.grants
property.description: the privileges automatically granted to some groups whenever a table gets created. An example like "groupX,groupY:select;groupZ:create" will grant select privilege to groupX and groupY, and grant create privilege to groupZ whenever a new table created.

property.name: hive.security.authorization.createtable.role.grants
property.description: the privileges automatically granted to some roles whenever a table gets created. An example like "roleX,roleY:select;roleZ:create" will grant select privilege to roleX and roleY, and grant create privilege to roleZ whenever a new table created.

property.name: hive.security.authorization.createtable.owner.grants
property.description: the privileges automatically granted to the owner whenever a table gets created. An example like "select,drop" will grant select and drop privilege to the owner of the table

property.name: hive.metastore.authorization.storage.checks
property.description: Should the metastore do authorization checks against the underlying storage for operations like drop-partition (disallow the drop-partition if the user in question doesn't have permissions to delete the corresponding directory on the storage).

property.name: hive.error.on.empty.partition
property.description: Whether to throw an excpetion if dynamic partition insert generates empty results.

property.name: hive.index.compact.file.ignore.hdfs
property.description: True the hdfs location stored in the index file will be igbored at runtime. If the data got moved or the name of the cluster got changed, the index data should still be usable.

property.name: hive.optimize.index.filter.compact.minsize
property.description: Minimum size (in bytes) of the inputs on which a compact index is automatically used.

property.name: hive.optimize.index.filter.compact.maxsize
property.description: Maximum size (in bytes) of the inputs on which a compact index is automatically used. A negative number is equivalent to infinity.

property.name: hive.index.compact.query.max.size
property.description: The maximum number of bytes that a query using the compact index can read. Negative value is equivalent to infinity.

property.name: hive.index.compact.query.max.entries
property.description: The maximum number of index entries to read during a query that uses the compact index. Negative value is equivalent to infinity.

property.name: hive.exim.uri.scheme.whitelist
property.description: A comma separated list of acceptable URI schemes for import and export.

property.name: hive.lock.mapred.only.operation
property.description: This param is to control whether or not only do lock on queries that need to execute at least one mapred job.

property.name: hive.limit.row.max.size
property.description: When trying a smaller subset of data for simple LIMIT, how much size we need to guarantee each row to have at least.

property.name: hive.limit.optimize.limit.file
property.description: When trying a smaller subset of data for simple LIMIT, maximum number of files we can sample.

property.name: hive.limit.optimize.enable
property.description: Whether to enable to optimization to trying a smaller subset of data for simple LIMIT first.

property.name: hive.limit.optimize.fetch.max
property.description: Maximum number of rows allowed for a smaller subset of data for simple LIMIT, if it is a fetch query. Insert queries are not restricted by this limit.

property.name: hive.rework.mapredwork
property.description: should rework the mapred work or not. This is first introduced by SymlinkTextInputFormat to replace symlink files with real paths at compile time.

property.name: hive.exec.concatenate.check.index
property.description: If this sets to true, hive will throw error when doing 'alter table tbl_name [partSpec] concatenate' on a table/partition that has indexes on it. The reason the user want to set this to true is because it can help user to avoid handling all index drop, recreation, rebuild work. This is very helpful for tables with thousands of partitions.

property.name: hive.sample.seednumber
property.description: A number used to percentage sampling. By changing this number, user will change the subsets of data sampled.

property.name: hive.io.exception.handlers
property.description: A list of io exception handler class names. This is used to construct a list exception handlers to handle exceptions thrown by record readers

property.name: hive.autogen.columnalias.prefix.label
property.description: String used as a prefix when auto generating column alias. By default the prefix label will be appended with a column position number to form the column alias. Auto generation would happen if an aggregate function is used in a select clause without an explicit alias.

property.name: hive.autogen.columnalias.prefix.includefuncname
property.description: Whether to include function name in the column alias auto generated by hive.

property.name: hive.exec.perf.logger
property.description: The class responsible logging client side performance metrics. Must be a subclass of org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.log.PerfLogger
